title: 11 Spots to Get Your Ramen Fix in Southeast Michigan
text:
11 Spots to Get Your Ramen Fix in Southeast Michigan All Feb 23, 2017, 3:29pm EST Johnny Noodle King. Michelle and Chris Gerard 
While ramen hasn't exactly caught on as a trend Michigan in the same way it has in other regions of the U.S., that doesn't necessarily mean the greater metro area is completely devoid of noodles. 
In recent years, there have been new hot spots for ramen, such as Southwest Detroit's Johnny Noodle King and the Ann Arbor outpost of Chicago-based ramen restaurant Slurping Turtle. Pop-ups like Dr. Sushi have also delved into the savory noodle soup, while Public House has introduced lunch specials exploring the Japanese specialty. 
Simply put, there's no need to settle for the instant ramen of your college dorm days. Here are 11 essential spots to get your slurp on in southeast Michigan (and maybe even fit in a rendition or two of your favorite '80s power ballad or K-Pop song). 
Did we miss your favorite ramen spot? Passionately m ake your case in the comments Twitter , Facebook , or community forums . Restaurants are listed geographically, never ranked. Eater Detroit's radius includes the Metro Detroit area and occasionally stretches into Southeast Michigan although our main focus is Detroit proper. 1 Matsuchan 
With hearty, hefty pork broth-based bowls, this cozy mom and pop shop dishes up traditional ramen, making Canton a destination spot â€” and not just for Ikea. The miso and shio are popular among fans, as well as the curry.
